meanings.definition: To reverse the process of creating something.
meanings.sent1: She regretted uncreating the beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The magician was skilled at uncreating objects with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally uncreated her masterpiece and had to start over.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to uncreate the peaceful landscape, leaving chaos in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment went wrong, uncreating all her hard work in an instant.

meanings.definition: The act of undoing or reversing the creation of something.
meanings.sent1: The uncreating of the sculpture was a heartbreaking moment for the artist.
meanings.sent2: He witnessed the uncreating of the sandcastle as the waves washed it away.
meanings.sent3: The uncreating of the cake was accidental, but it turned out to be a funny disaster.
meanings.sent4: The uncreating of the building's design left the architect feeling defeated.
meanings.sent5: The uncreating of the friendship happened slowly over time, unnoticed until it was too late.
